intro: Roodia braunsii, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is well adapted to arid conditions. It features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Roodia braunsii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
